comment._content: An attempt to echo this shot... Now I've been there I'm not so sure it's exactly the right place, I thought it was Macquarie St looking east along Shakespeare Place but so much has changed in the area. Even the statue is different, the original statue on a square plinth with a single figure, the "new" one on a rounded plinth with others around the base. The Mitchell Library presumably the building on the right in the original shot but now hidden behind palms.

Yes, Speedy MSD, I'm sure you are right.  It's a very good comparison, because the Mitchell Library is on the right in both shots.

It's common for statues and memorials to be moved from place to place to accommodate road widening or realignment.

comment.author: 8108294@N05
comment._content:
Yes, and that's the Domain's Fig Tree Avenue stretching back to the rear. Before the Cahill Expressway was built in the early 60s it was flanked by imposing large Moreton Bay Figs, which are hardly evident in this shot. But then these figs grow a lot faster than is generally supposed.

Judging by the people's clothing the photo would appear to date from around 1900-1910. Hansom-cabs were still around then. My 95-year-old father remembers being driven home in one that plied from a rank at Lindfield (or possibly Roseville) Station, and that would have been closer to 1920.
